thread.title: UGA hosting one of nation's best on Saturday
thread.title_full: UGA hosting one of nation's best on Saturday

title: UGA hosting one of nation's best on Saturday
text:
UGA hosting one of nation's best on Saturday The nation's No. 2 overall player in the 2019 class will visit Georgia on Saturday.   
One of the nation's best overall prospects for the 2019 class will be on Georgia's campus Saturday. Grayson linebacker Owen Pappoe tweeted Friday that he would be making the short 45 minute trip to Athens "tomorrow," giving the Bulldogs a chance to host the No. 2 ranked player in America for his class according to the industry-generated 247Sports Composite.   
Pappoe was a part of a state championship team a year ago at Grayson along with 2017 Bulldog signee D'Angelo Gibbs. Pappoe, who began receiving offers while he was in the eighth grade, visited the Bulldogs multiple times for games this season as well as last spring. 
He holds 36 reported offers going into his junior season and is ranked as the top player in the Peach State for 2019 and is considered the nation's best outside linebacker prospect. 
There are four selections in his 247Sports Crystal Ball at present. Two have gone for UGA with Alabama and Florida State getting one each.
